meanings.definition: The portico or vestibule of a Greek temple.
meanings.sent1: The epinaos of the temple provided shelter from the sun.
meanings.sent2: Visitors gathered in the epinaos before entering the temple.
meanings.sent3: The pigeons found a cozy spot in the epinaos, enjoying the shade.
meanings.sent4: The epinaos stood like a welcoming gate to the temple's grandeur.
meanings.sent5: The intricate carvings on the epinaos made it a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The main room of a temple, especially in ancient Greece.
meanings.sent1: The priest conducted ceremonies in the epinaos of the temple.
meanings.sent2: People gathered in the epinaos to pay their respects to the gods.
meanings.sent3: The children played hide-and-seek in the vast epinaos, giggling.
meanings.sent4: The epinaos echoed with the prayers of the devoted worshippers.
meanings.sent5: The flickering torches illuminated the epinaos, creating a mystical atmosphere.

meanings.definition: The innermost part of a temple, where the statue of a deity is located.
meanings.sent1: Only the priests were allowed to enter the sacred epinaos of the temple.
meanings.sent2: The epinaos housed the magnificent statue of the goddess Athena.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat sneaked into the epinaos and knocked over a vase.
meanings.sent4: The epinaos seemed to hold the very presence of the deity within its walls.
meanings.sent5: The flickering candlelight cast eerie shadows in the dim epinaos.
